keypoints: Sitka Gold has initiated its 2024 exploration at the newly acquired Clear Creek property.

title: Middle East player bags multimillion-dollar rig deals, to expand drilling fleet to 148 by 2026
keypoints: A Middle East company secured multimillion-dollar rig deals.
The company's drilling fleet is expected to expand to 148 rigs by 2026.
The rigs will be constructed by China's Honghua Group.

title: Federal Bills Call for Damaging Funding Cuts and Harmful Offshore Drilling
keypoints: House Fiscal Year 2025 budget bills propose significant funding cuts to ocean and coastal management programs.
The bills include mandates for new oil and gas leasing and limit protections for wildlife and natural ecosystems.
Proposed cuts include a 20% reduction to the EPA and a 12% reduction to NOAA.
The bills also weaken the ability of federal agencies to regulate pollution and address climate change.
The Surfrider Foundation is actively opposing these cuts and harmful policy riders.

title: Offshore Drilling Market Size Set to Surge, Forecasted to Reach USD 89.61 Billion by 2032
keypoints: The offshore drilling market is projected to grow significantly, reaching USD 89.61 billion by 2032.
This growth indicates a robust demand for offshore drilling services and technologies.
ADNOC Global Trading could benefit from understanding market trends and potential investment opportunities.

The expansion includes awarding contracts and boosting crude volumes supplied to the Ruwais refining complex.
This strategic move could enhance ADNOC's market position and trading prospects.

title: Bedford gas leak after drilling company hits natural gas pocket
keypoints: A drilling company caused a gas leak in Bedford after hitting a natural gas pocket.

title: Environmental coalition opposes Challenger Energy's bid to renew offshore drilling licenses
keypoints: Strong opposition from environmental coalitions against Challenger Energy's attempt to renew offshore drilling licenses in The Bahamas.

Public support for a permanent ban on oil drilling in Bahamian waters.
Potential impact on the marine environment and coastal ecosystems.
Challenger Energy's ongoing discussions with the government and alternative strategies to monetize assets.

title: ADNOC Drilling secures $733 million in offshore drilling contracts for massive Zakum oil field
keypoints: ADNOC Drilling Company PJSC has won $733 million in total contracts from ADNOC Offshore for three island drilling rigs.
The rigs will operate on artificial islands at the offshore Zakum field, using industry-leading technology and automation.
The partnership between ADNOC Drilling and Honghua Group (HH) aims to harness AI and digitization in the rigs' design and operation.
The rigs will utilize real-time data for enhanced performance, efficiency, safety, and well delivery times.
These rigs are capable of extended reach drilling (ERD) and can move between wells without dismantling, improving efficiency and reducing costs and emissions.
ADNOC Drilling's fleet is expected to total at least 148 rigs by 2026, including these new rigs.
The partnership emphasizes AI and innovation to maximize energy, minimize emissions, and unlock value for stakeholders.

title: Rig arrives in Canada ready to launch key exploration campaign
keypoints: Hercules semisub rig has arrived in Bay Bulls, Newfoundland & Labrador, Canada.
The rig will drill two wells for Equinor as part of a key exploration campaign.
Highlights the ongoing exploration activities in Canada, relevant for market dynamics and investment opportunities.

title: Ambitious junior finalises licences for two promising Caribbean exploration blocks
keypoints: Touchstone Exploration has completed the entry into two onshore blocks in Trinidad & Tobago.
The exploration blocks are seen as promising for future oil and gas development.
This move signifies ongoing interest and investment in the Caribbean region's oil and gas potential.
The licenses were finalized by Touchstone Exploration's CEO, Paul Baay.

title: Offshore drilling surge creates turnaround for Australian exploration
keypoints: Australian offshore petroleum drilling expenditure surged to $337 million in the March quarter of 2024, marking a significant turnaround from $254 million in 2023.
The increase in exploration spending highlights renewed interest and investment in Australia's petroleum sector, which had been struggling in previous years.

title: ExxonMobil lands promising pair of exploration blocks in North Africa
keypoints: ExxonMobil has acquired two exploration blocks in shallow water offshore Morocco, aiming to assess their oil and gas potential.
The acquisition signifies ExxonMobil's continued interest in expanding its exploration activities in North Africa.

title: Rig arrives in Canada ready to launch key exploration campaign
keypoints: The Hercules semisub drilling rig has arrived in Newfoundland & Labrador, Canada, to begin a key exploration campaign for Equinor.
The rig will drill two wells, marking a significant step in Equinor's exploration efforts in the region.

title: Nicola Mining Announces Completion of 3D IP Survey and Commencement of Exploration Drilling at the New ...
keypoints: Nicola Mining has completed a 3D induced polarization survey at its New Craigmont Copper Project in British Columbia.
The survey identified multiple high-potential drilling targets, leading to the commencement of a 5,000-meter diamond drilling program.
The focus will be on the West Craigmont Zone, with potential additional drilling at MARB/CAS later in the summer.

title: Adnoc expands Zakum offshore drilling fleet, output boost from 2026
keypoints: ADNOC is set to boost production from the giant offshore Zakum field, with increased output expected from 2026.
ADNOC has boosted volumes of the medium sour Upper Zakum crude supplied to its Ruwais refining complex.
ADNOC Logistics and Services (L&S) has been awarded its first major contract for the new Lower Zakum island.
ADNOC Drilling has been awarded a $412 million contract for the Upper Zakum expansion.

title: ExxonMobil lands promising pair of exploration blocks in North Africa
keypoints: ExxonMobil has acquired two exploration blocks in North Africa, specifically offshore Morocco.
The company aims to assess the oil and gas potential of these shallow water acreages.
This move indicates ExxonMobil's strategic interest in expanding its presence in North Africa's oil and gas sector.

title: Ambitious junior finalises licences for two promising Caribbean exploration blocks
keypoints: Touchstone Exploration has completed its entry into two onshore exploration blocks in Trinidad & Tobago.
These blocks are considered promising for potential oil and gas discoveries.
This move signifies Touchstone Exploration's strategic expansion in the Caribbean region.

title: Exploration Co. Announces MRE & 2024 Drilling Program
keypoints: Metallic Minerals Corp. announced its maiden NI 43-101 mineral resource estimate (MRE) at the Keno Silver project.
The MRE includes four separate deposits with an inferred resource of 2.5 Mt at 223 g/t AgEq, equating to 18.16 Moz of contained AgEq.
The company's 2024 drilling program has been initiated at both the La Plata and Keno Silver projects, focusing on resource expansion and new discoveries.
Newmont Corp. has exercised its 'top-up right' to maintain its 9.5% stake in Metallic Minerals, indicating confidence in the company's resource potential.
Couloir Capital's fair value per share estimate for Metallic Minerals is CA$0.47, representing a 61.08% upside from the current price.

title: [Updated] Drilling Engineering and Technical Services Market Size Analysis | Jereh Oilfield Services Group, ZPEC ...
keypoints: The 2024 Global Drilling Engineering and Technical Services Market report provides comprehensive industry insights from 2024 to 2031.
Key market players include Jereh Oilfield Services Group, ZPEC, Rutong, Sinopec, CNOOC, Anton Oilfield Services Group, Schlumberger, Haliburton, Baker Hughes, Renzhi, Petrolor, and Sinogeo.
The report delves into pricing, geographical regions, technology, and supply and demand dynamics.
Market segmentation includes offshore and onshore drilling, with applications in oil, natural gas, and other sectors.
Key strategies employed by market players include product innovation, strategic partnerships, acquisitions, and investments in R&D.

title: Nicola Mining Announces Completion of 3D IP Survey and Commencement of Exploration Drilling at the New ...
keypoints: Nicola Mining completed a 3D induced polarization (IP) survey at the New Craigmont Copper Project.
The survey identified significant resistivity and chargeability anomalies, indicating potential copper-rich areas.
Nicola Mining commenced its 2024 diamond drilling program, targeting 5,000 meters of core drilling.
Initial drilling will focus on the West Craigmont Zone, with possible expansion to the MARB/CAS areas later in the summer.
The survey was conducted by Dias Geophysical and covered approximately 6.5 square kilometers.

title: Drilling barge ready for Eni's Caspian Sea wildcat
keypoints: The Caspian Explorer drilling barge, owned by UK-listed Caspian Sunrise, is ready for Eni's wildcat drilling in the Caspian Sea.
The barge is located in the Kazakh port of Aktau.
The owner hopes drilling success might lead to trading the barge for a minority interest in an offshore Kazakhstan development.
This development could impact Eni and KazMunayGaz's exploration activities in the region.
